abstract: New research by Thomson Reuters tries to draw a more accurate link between corporate patent filings and real innovation. It measures not only the number of patents a company files, but also their quality and influence. A couple of surprises: No Chinese companies made the list of 100 top innovators, and software as an industry did poorly.

lead_paragraph: Innovation is a decidedly tricky thing to measure. Patents are the most widely used yardstick, but they are an imperfect gauge of innovation at best.

headline.main: In Innovation Race, China Is Not Yet a Rival, Study Says
